snippet: Prime Minister Shinzo Abe said the new law would strengthen national security, but opponents warned it would stifle democracy.
abstract: Japan's Parliament passes controversial secrecy law that Prime Min Shinzo Abe says will strengthen national security by making it easier to share classified intelligence with allies like United States; opponents say law will stifle democracy.
lead_paragraph: Prime Minister Shinzo Abe said the new law would strengthen national security, but opponents warned it would stifle democracy.

headline.main: Japan’s Parliament Approves a Secrecy Law Amid Protests
